decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Underworld Breach and Hidden Strings to generate infinite loops of mana and card advantage. By combining Twiddle effects, Consign to Memory, and Vizier of Tumbling Sands, the deck can consistently dig through the library to assemble the necessary pieces for a game-winning combo. The inclusion of Wish allows for additional flexibility in finding specific cards needed to execute the combo. With careful planning and resource management, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and achieve victory through its intricate and powerful combo interactions.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with spells like Thoughtseize and Static Prison. The deck also features a companion, Jegantha, the Wellspring, to provide additional flexibility and synergy with the deck's mana base. By combining efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Orcish Bowmasters with powerful spells and versatile planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the Mardu Aggro archetype aims to assert dominance on the battlefield and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck revolves around using a combination of creatures and tools to quickly assemble powerful combos and disrupt opponents. The deck includes various creatures with unique abilities that can be searched for and put into play using cards like Chord of Calling. It also includes tools like Shuko and Malevolent Rumble to manipulate the board and control the game. The key strategy is to effectively toolbox for the right creatures and combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its versatile toolkit and combo potential.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler, and key spells like Counterspell and Force of Negation to keep the opponent's threats in check. The deck also has versatile removal options like Prismatic Ending and Solitude, while also including powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. By controlling the battlefield and outlasting the opponent, the deck aims to win the game through attrition and careful decision-making.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to take control of the game through a combination of countering spells, targeted removal, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Archmage's Charm, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own threats such as Murktide Regent. The deck also includes cards like Psychic Frog and Sink into Stupor to generate card advantage and slow down the opponent's game plan. Overall, the goal of this deck is to control the game and out-value the opponent through efficient removal and powerful threats.

The main focus of this Control - UrzaTron deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of colorless mana and cast powerful spells like Karn, the Great Creator and All Is Dust. The deck also utilizes Eldrazi creatures like Devourer of Destiny and World Breaker to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Dismember and Sowing Mycospawn provide additional removal and utility to help the player maintain control of the game.

The main goal of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while utilizing Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion for additional support. By combining cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart with creature pump spells like Mutagenic Growth, the deck aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the board. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Underworld Breach and Mishra's Bauble for card advantage and graveyard interaction, making it a fast-paced and explosive deck that aims to win quickly.

This Mono Black Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with cards like Grief and Inquisition of Kozilek while also controlling the battlefield with cards like Fell the Profane and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. Using Necrodominance and Malakir Rebirth to bring back creatures like Boggart Trawler and Orcish Bowmasters to maintain board presence. The deck also has cards like Soul Spike for direct damage and The One Ring for additional control. Phyrexian Tower and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth provide mana support for the deck.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by using a combination of hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane, and powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. It also leverages graveyard recursion with cards like Malakir Rebirth and Necrodominance to maintain board control. The win condition comes from draining the opponent's life total with cards like Soul Spike and March of Wretched Sorrow, while also utilizing strong creatures like Boggart Trawler and Grief to pressure the opponent.
